content: Are there equivalent Access Christianity, Access Buddhism, Access Vedic Hinduism, Access Wiccan programs in the schools? If not, schools that use the Access Islam program are singling out Islam for special favorable treatment — IOW, establishing a religion. The excuse, “Islamophobia,” shows the insidiousness of the very term. The use of the term “Islamophobia” is a way to conflate actual crimes — torching a mosque, eg. — with simple opinion, that Islam is BS (which it is.) So the cure for this “Islamophobia,” meaning unwelcome opinion, is “understanding”…that is, an exposition about the history and doctrines of Islam from an Islamic point of view, to the disadvantage of other religions. Establishment of religion that would not be tolerated for other religious groups, such as setting aside school property for prayer rooms, is now viewed favorably by leftists as a “reasonable accommodation” for Muslims. If the government gives a grant to an educational corporation, which then makes a pro-Islam (or pro any other religion) program for schools, that is a complete violation of the Establishment clause.
